A Specification refers to a that completes the semantics of the Specification. 'green', 'white', or 'black' are examples for specifications belonging to the of type 'colour'. 'set of 3 drawers' or 'set of 5 drawers' are examples for specifications belonging to the of type 'additional feature'.

a boolean value that specifies whether this Specification represents a package of specifications. Such a Specification combines those specifications that shall be offered to the market as a set.
In the case where package is 'true', there shall be exactly one per considered, that refers to this Specification as . The Specification instances that are members of the package, shall be identified within a referred to by the as . Commercial packages may be defined by the marketing department. Usually the members of a package belong to distinct specification categories.
A sports package for a of cars contains sports seats, a special steering wheel, special tires and wheels. A winter package contains heated front seats, heated windshield washers, heated exterior mirrors, and special tires.

A Specification_category is the identification of a set of specifications serving the same purpose. The category 'colours', containing the specifications 'green' and 'white' and the category 'additional features', containing the specifications 'set of 3 drawers', 'set of 5 drawers', are examples for a Specification_category.

a boolean value that specifies whether the specifications within the Specification_category are mutually exclusive for the production of a particular product. A value of 'true' indicates that the referenced objects are mutually exclusive. 'additional features' is an example for a non mutually exclusive Specification_category if, for example, 'set of 3 drawers' and 'door with mirror' are instances in this category. 'colours' is an example for a Specification_category with an implicit_exclusive_condition since usually the product can have only one 'colour'.
More complex conditions can be handled using instances of .

the identifier of the Specification_category that shall be unique. The scope of uniqueness is usually dependent on the form of implementation. The scope of uniqueness may be, for example, constrained by the extent of a physical file or data base.

a text that provides additional information about the Specification_category.
The description 'trim' may characterize a Specification_category for instances of that control quality and colour of the finishing of the product including, for example, door panels and upholstery.

A Specification_category_hierarchy is used to build up hierarchical structures of instances of . The "Type of cover", for sofas, contains the specifications: "Leather" and "Alcantara". The "Leather cover kind", containing the specifications "Buffalo cover" and "Kidskin cover", may be a sub_category of the "Type of cover".
The fact that a is a sub_category of another does not involve that this sub_category inherits the associations of the super_category with product classes.

A Specification_expression is a combination of instances formed with Boolean operations.
If color "Light blue" of sofa when selected with "Alcantara" coating requires a special finishing operation, a Specification_expression with the expression "Light blue" AND "Alcantara", will be created to be used to define a use case of that particular process operation.
